body.div: Interrogatories for Doctor willoughby
$1$ What tyme he first knewe of thies matteres & by whom.
$2$ what communication he had with Serles opon palme sonday
$3$ whether Doctor london dyd penne the articles new
that Serles brought to hym, & altered the articles.
$4 3$ Whether Serles said to this deponent, beware what
you do, for you shal never be able to prove theym after this
sorte that Doctor london doth nowe hath penned theym.
whether the wordes were spoken openly that D london
myght heare theym.
$4$ whether this deponent said to any person that the Busshope
of wynchester wolde gyve VIm li to plucke downe tharch-
busshope of Cantorbury.
$5$ whether the next day Serles wrote to this deponent
to procede ernestly & boldely with Doctor london as he had
bygonne.
$6 4$ what tyme it was that he said to Gardiner that he wolde
take opon hym to be the only doer in this matter.
$7 5$ whatt he dyd with the copie of the articles that were
delyvered to hym the same tyme
$8 6$ whether he shewed the last booke that Shether sent
to hym by his servant, to the busshope of winchester or not
$9 7$ which of the cownceil dyd alowe hym for puttynge up
of the boke, sayinge that he was a good catholicke man,
& dyd animat hym to be bolde to present mo such
accusementes.
$10 8$ what confortable wordes the counseil gave hym to go about
thies matteres.
$11 9$ who informed hym that a commission sholde com down into
kent, & that Parkehurst, milles & Gardiner sholde be commissioneres
$12 10$ what communication he had with Mr. ffoggre of a ser lecture which
the Archbusshope sholde reade of the sacrament of thaultare,
& who were present, & what was said of every man.
$11$ how many were named to be commissioneres.
